quoteFirst: Then, after a while, the periscope was sighted 500 yards away on the port beam, so _Penshurst_, knowing a torpedo was imminent, waited, and, the torpedo having been sent, altered course to avoid it, just missing by a matter of 10 feet. The ship’s company then went to ‘panic’ stations and the ship was ‘abandoned.’ At
quoteLast: the enemy came to the surface 5,000 yards away on the starboard quarter, at 3.39 p.m. opened fire and continued until 4.13 p.m., when _Penshurst_ herself started firing at 4,500 yards, succeeding in hitting the enemy sixteen times, and undoubtedly seriously damaging him.
title: Q-Ships and Their Story
author: Chatterton, E. Keble (Edward Keble), 1878-1944
